description: From opinion +â€Ž -ate, perhaps after Middle French opinionner.

adjectives.description: opinionate (comparative more opinionate, superlative most opinionate)

verbs.description: opinionate (third-person singular simple present opinionates, present participle opinionating, simple past and past participle opinionated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To have or express as an opinion; to opine.
examples: He doesn't editorialize and he doesn't try to opinionate. It is just the facts.
